start.text: You open your eyes, feeling exhausted, staring at the mirror with self-loathing.

choices.text: Try to collect yourself and prepare for class
Keep sitting on the bed, doing nothing

classroom.text: You arrive at the classroom, and the physics teacher calls you to solve a problem on the board, but you are completely lost.

choices.text: Try to solve the problem
Stay silent and lower your head

despair.text: You sit on the bed, feeling like a complete failure. The thought of punishment for being late adds to your anxiety.

choices.text: Reluctantly go to class
Decide to take the day off and avoid everything

try_solution.text: You try hard to solve the problem but realize you can’t figure it out. The teacher harshly criticizes you, leaving you feeling embarrassed and blank.

choices.text: Stand silently until class ends
Mutter an apology and return to your seat

after_class.text: After class, you quietly return to your seat, feeling drained. A classmate who you rarely talk to says, 'Don’t worry about it,' bringing a small warmth to your heart.

choices.text: Muster the courage to say 'Thank you'
Force a smile and stay silent

shame.text: You lower your head, feeling the mocking gazes of the entire class. Your self-esteem takes a huge hit.

choices.text: Pretend to stay calm and wait for class to end
Run out of the classroom immediately

avoidance.text: You choose to avoid the situation, but it doesn’t ease your pain. You feel utterly hopeless.

choices.text: Reflect and try to face it again
Completely give up and sink into deeper self-blame

end_success.text: Although you felt immense pressure, you held on. After class, a classmate expressed concern for you, which brought a small warmth to your heart.
end_success.education: Perseverance and seeking support are crucial for helping people with depression. Even a small act of kindness can change someone's world.

end_normal.text: You barely made it to the end of class, but you still feel defeated and that nothing has changed.
end_normal.education: People with depression often feel defeated despite their efforts, but this is part of the recovery process. Patience and support are key.

end_bad.text: You completely give up on yourself, sinking into deep despair. No one understands you, and you feel abandoned by the world.
end_bad.education: People with depression often feel hopeless, but seeking psychological help in time can save lives. Care and listening are crucial.

after_school.text: After school, you walk home alone, hearing the laughter of other students. Yet, you feel out of place in this world.

choices.text: Try sending a message to a friend
Lower your head and walk home quickly

friend_response.text: You send a message: 'Are you there?' A few minutes later, the other person replies with a busy emoji, and you feel disappointed.

choices.text: Tell yourself not to bother others again
Persist and try to chat with them

small_relief.text: Although the other person didn’t chat deeply, you feel a little better. Maybe you’re not completely ignored.

choices.text: Go home and continue studying
Stare into space until late at night

night_crisis.text: Late at night, you sit on your bed, your mind a mess. Negative emotions overwhelm you, making it hard to breathe.

choices.text: Call a mental health hotline
Decide to endure and do nothing

call_hotline.text: You dial a mental health hotline, and a warm voice comforts you. For the first time, you feel you’re not alone.
call_hotline.education: Mental health hotlines can help those with depression manage crises. Seeking timely help is crucial.

choices.text: Restart the game

at_home.text: You arrive home. Your mother is busy taking care of your younger sibling, leaving you feeling ignored. You lie in bed, staring into space.

choices.text: Close your eyes and sleep
Try to talk to your mother
